result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:52 AM Defendant Steven Douglas Kozlik in court.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Steven Douglas Kozlik.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense has rec'd discovery.  The State is waiting on blood results from the lab.  State has not tendered an offer.  State will once the results are back.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

***ALSO $10,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

9:12 AM Defendant Steven Douglas Kozlik in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Steven Douglas Kozlik.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State calls Investigator S. Diener- DSAT.
Defense on cross.
Parties rest.
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects.
BTC: Testimony given, probable cause found,  bound over. 
Defense requests bond modification with argument.  State objects.  BTC: Bond modification granted to a $2000 cash bond and a $10,000 signature bond, Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
